title: Titan of terror: The dark imagination of H.P. Lovecraft - Silvia Moreno-Garc√≠a

multiple-choice.question: What elements have become standard in many modern horror stories, largely popularized by H.P. Lovecraft?

options.label: A
options.text: Vampires, werewolves, and zombies

options.label: B
options.text: Arcane books of forbidden lore, disturbing secrets in the family bloodline, and terrors that might drive you mad

options.label: C
options.text: Superheroes, magic, and fantasy creatures

options.label: D
options.text: Space exploration, aliens, and futuristic technology

multiple-choice.question: Who were some of the authors that influenced H.P. Lovecraft's writing style?

options.label: A
options.text: Edgar Allan Poe and Robert Chambers

options.label: B
options.text: Stephen King and Clive Barker

options.label: C
options.text: Bram Stoker and Mary Shelley

options.label: D
options.text: Robert E. Howard and Robert Bloch

multiple-choice.question: What was the context in which Lovecraft began writing horror stories in 1917?

options.label: A
options.text: During a time of great economic prosperity and peace

options.label: B
options.text: During World War I, which had cast a long shadow over the arts

options.label: C
options.text: During the Great Depression, which had led to widespread poverty and despair

options.label: D
options.text: During the Roaring Twenties, which were marked by great social change and cultural upheaval

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the shared universe created by Lovecraft and his contemporaries?

options.label: A
options.text: The Cthulhu Mythos

options.label: B
options.text: The Lovecraftian Universe

options.label: C
options.text: The Horrorverse

options.label: D
options.text: The Dark Dimension

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the creature that is a blend of dragon and octopus, and is one of Lovecraft's most infamous creations?

options.label: A
options.text: Cthulhu

options.label: B
options.text: Yog-Sothoth

options.label: C
options.text: Azathoth

options.label: D
options.text: Shub-Niggurath

multiple-choice.question: What is the central theme of Lovecraftian horror?

options.label: A
options.text: The power of good vs. evil

options.label: B
options.text: The struggle for survival in a post-apocalyptic world

options.label: C
options.text: The terror of the unknown, and the insignificance of humanity in the face of cosmic forces

options.label: D
options.text: The dangers of science and technology

multiple-choice.question: How did Lovecraft's personal views affect his writing?

options.label: A
options.text: His writing was unaffected by his personal views

options.label: B
options.text: His writing was influenced by his strong racist views, which are evident in some of his works

options.label: C
options.text: His writing was influenced by his strong feminist views, which are evident in some of his works

options.label: D
options.text: His writing was influenced by his strong anti-war views, which are evident in some of his works

multiple-choice.question: What was Lovecraft's financial situation at the time of his death?

options.label: A
options.text: He was a wealthy and successful author

options.label: B
options.text: He was struggling to make ends meet, but was able to support himself through his writing

options.label: C
options.text: He was unknown and penniless, and died in poverty

options.label: D
options.text: He was a successful businessman, and his writing was just a hobby

multiple-choice.question: What has been the legacy of Lovecraft's work?

options.label: A
options.text: His work has been largely forgotten, and he is no longer considered an important author

options.label: B
options.text: His work has had a significant influence on the horror genre, and he is considered a master of cosmic horror

options.label: C
options.text: His work has been widely criticized for its racist and sexist themes, and he is no longer considered a relevant author

options.label: D
options.text: His work has been largely ignored by scholars and critics, and he is not considered an important author

multiple-choice.question: Why will Lovecraftian horror continue to have a place in popular culture?

options.label: A
options.text: Because it is a nostalgic reminder of the past

options.label: B
options.text: Because it is a way to escape the stresses of everyday life

options.label: C
options.text: Because it taps into our deep-seated fears of the unknown, and our insignificance in the face of cosmic forces

options.label: D
options.text: Because it is a way to experience fear in a safe and controlled environment

title: The hidden network that makes the internet possible - Sajan Saini

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary material used in fiber optic cables?

options.label: A
options.text: Copper

options.label: B
options.text: Glass

options.label: C
options.text: Silicon

options.label: D
options.text: Metal

multiple-choice.question: What phenomenon allows light to travel within glass fibers instead of passing through them?

options.label: A
options.text: Total internal reflection

options.label: B
options.text: Refraction

options.label: C
options.text: Diffraction

options.label: D
options.text: Interference

multiple-choice.question: What is the main advantage of fiber optic signals over electrical signals?

options.label: A
options.text: They are faster

options.label: B
options.text: They are cheaper

options.label: C
options.text: They barely degrade over great distances

options.label: D
options.text: They are more secure

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of integrated photonics in relation to fiber optics?

options.label: A
options.text: To increase the speed of fiber optic signals

options.label: B
options.text: To reduce the cost of fiber optic cables

options.label: C
options.text: To enable the use of fiber optics in data centers and mobile devices

options.label: D
options.text: To improve the security of fiber optic signals

multiple-choice.question: What is the main problem with traditional electrical cables in data centers?

options.label: A
options.text: They are too slow

options.label: B
options.text: They are too expensive

options.label: C
options.text: They waste too much power as heat

options.label: D
options.text: They are too insecure

multiple-choice.question: What is the benefit of using photonic chips in data centers?

options.label: A
options.text: They increase the speed of data transfer

options.label: B
options.text: They reduce the power consumption of data centers

options.label: C
options.text: They improve the security of data transfer

options.label: D
options.text: They reduce the cost of data centers

multiple-choice.question: What is the main limitation of terahertz frequencies in wireless communication?

options.label: A
options.text: They are too slow

options.label: B
options.text: They are too expensive

options.label: C
options.text: They get absorbed by moisture in the air or blocked by tall buildings

options.label: D
options.text: They are too insecure

multiple-choice.question: How can photonic chips help overcome the limitations of terahertz frequencies in wireless communication?

options.label: A
options.text: By amplifying the signals

options.label: B
options.text: By relaying the signals over long-range distances via optical fiber

options.label: C
options.text: By reducing the power consumption of wireless devices

options.label: D
options.text: By improving the security of wireless communication

multiple-choice.question: What is the main benefit of using fiber optics in communication?

options.label: A
options.text: It allows for faster data transfer

options.label: B
options.text: It reduces the power consumption of communication devices

options.label: C
options.text: It enables the creation of a planetary computer

options.label: D
options.text: It improves the security of communication

multiple-choice.question: What is the main idea of the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: The history of fiber optics

options.label: B
options.text: The benefits of fiber optics in communication

options.label: C
options.text: The limitations of fiber optics in communication

options.label: D
options.text: The future of fiber optics in communication
